title: Business Council of Australia
snippet: The Business Council of Australia drives the nation’s economic agenda, leveraging the expertise of Australia’s leading businesses to advocate for policy solutions that ensure prosperity and fairness.

title: Business Council of Australia Information
snippet: Business Council of Australia is a Public Policy Offices, Membership Organizations, and Organizations company located in Melbourne, Victoria with $43.5 million in revenue and 46 employees.

title: Business Council of Australia - Wikipedia
snippet: The Australian Industries Protection League (AIPL) was established in Melbourne in January 1919 as a successor to the Protectionist Association of Victoria. James Hume Cook, a former federal MP and ally of Nationalist leader Billy Hughes, was appointed secretary of the organisation in 1922 and held the position until his death in 1942. He represented the league at the British Empire Economic Conference in Ottawa in 1932.
